doc:
Richard Gallo (performance artist) https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_Gallo_(performance_artist) 0 Richard Gallo (1946-2007) was an American stage actor, performance artist, and experimental theater stage director, noted mostly for his street performances and provocative costumes. His work blurred the boundaries between performance art, theatre, and fashion. Gallo performed outside the luxury stores and hotels on Fifth Avenue wearing costumes that referenced glamour, sadomasochism, and high fashion. His street performances challenged mainstream conceptions of identity, masculinity, and sexuality. He was known as “Lemon Boy" for his use of lemons as props. Richard_Gallo ( 1946-2007 ) was an_American_stage_actor , performance_artist , and experimental_theater_stage_director , noted mostly for his_street_performances and provocative_costumes . His_work blurred the_boundaries between performance_art , theatre , and fashion . Gallo performed outside the_luxury_stores and hotels on Fifth_Avenue wearing costumes that referenced glamour , sadomasochism , and high_fashion . His_street_performances challenged mainstream_conceptions of identity , masculinity , and sexuality . He was_known as “ Lemon_Boy " for his_use of lemons as props .
